title: Cara Delevingne says she's 'the luckiest girl' due to Ashley Benson
text:
Their romance has gone from strength to strength since they first started dating in May 2018.

And Cara Delevingne praised girlfriend Ashley Benson for making her feel like the 'luckiest girl in the world' as she attended the 2019 Girl Up #GirlHero Awards in Los Angeles on Sunday,

The model, 27, waxed lyrical about her Pretty Little Liars star partner, 29, while chatting with E! News.

Happy: Cara Delevingne praised girlfriend Ashley Benson for making her feel like the 'luckiest girl in the world' as she attended the 2019 Girl Up #GirlHero Awards in Los Angeles on Sunday

Loved: The couple's romance has gone from strength to strength since they first started dating in May 2018 (pictured last month)

She said: 'It's so nice to have someone in my life that supports me so much and loves me. I'm the luckiest girl in the world.'

Discussing being honoured at the luncheon, which recognises leaders who push for gender equality, Cara said: 'It's a really big deal to me. Especially since I think Girl Up is such an amazing organization.'

When asked what advice she would give to those struggling with their identity, she added: 'Just knowing that everyone has that same trouble. I mean, some people find it easier, but everyone's gone through that kind of second thinking, like "Am I really? Should I? How do I?"'

This year’s luncheon, held in recognition of International Day of the Girl, was hosted by Julianne Hough and is honoring Kate Hudson, Jameela Jamil and specific Girl Up girl changemakers.

Cute couple: She said: 'It's so nice to have someone in my life that supports me so much and loves me. I'm the luckiest girl in the world' (pictured September 2018)

According to its website, Girl Up is 'a global movement of empowered young women leaders who defend gender equality' utilizing leadership development training.

The organization was founded by the United Nations Foundation in 2010.

The candid interview comes as Cara recently spoke to Porter, the digital edition of Net-A-Porter, about why her bond with Ashley is different from her previous relationships.

'I’d never truly let anyone in before, for fear of them leaving. I never really trusted people, or felt worthy of it, and I always pushed them away,' shared Cara.

Smitten: The candid interview comes as Cara recently spoke to Porter , the digital edition of Net-A-Porter, about why her bond with Ashley is different from her previous relationships (pictured last month)

The model and actress said of Ashley: 'She’s the first person that has said: "You can’t push me away. I’m going to be nice to you, I love you."'

Cara recalled: 'I’m just like, wait, so all I have to do is just let you be nice to me? Why have I never done that before? OK.'

Although Ashley lives in Los Angeles and Cara's Amazon Prime show Carnival Row is shot in Prague, they have managed to keep the romance afloat.

'Long-distance relationships are always tough. We make it work, though. We have to. And it definitely makes me a better, happier person,' she said.
description: Cara Delevingne praised girlfriend Ashley Benson for making her feel like the 'luckiest girl in the world' as she attended the 2019 Girl Up #GirlHero Awards in Los Angeles on Sunday,
